title: Understanding SSRIs
text: SSRIs, or Selective Serotonin Reuptake Inhibitors, are a class of drugs commonly used to treat OCD. They work by increasing the level of serotonin in the brain.

title: Common SSRIs
text: Some of the most commonly prescribed SSRIs for OCD include fluoxetine, sertraline, and fluvoxamine.

hintAnswer: fluoxetine, sertraline, fluvoxamine, paoxetine, citalopram, escitalopram
title: Identifying SSRIs
text: Which of the following are SSRIs used for treating OCD?
choices: awareness training, competing response training, social support, motivation enhancement, generalization
fluoxetine, sertraline, fluvoxamine, paoxetine, citalopram, escitalopram
a noninvasive surgical procedure that uses radiation to destroy targeted brain tissue,
